The dynamics of what even Google calls its management "triumvirate" are somewhat murky, but the co-founders appear to worry more about idealism, while Eric Schmidt has advocated increased commercialization. Google policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, Eric Schmidt once said. on Friday it has no interest in using bankruptcy to solve its fiscal problems. California, the eighth largest economy in the world, would not benefit from bankruptcy legislation, Treasurer Bill Lockyer said. States didn't ask for it. We don't want it. We don't need it, Bill Lockyer said. "Bankruptcy would devastate states' ability to recover from the recession and make the infrastructure investments that create good jobs." Sergio Marchionne said he wanted to introduce profit-sharing plans for Fiat's Italian workers, while stressing we have to make profits( at the plants), before we can share them. The car manufacturer met fierce opposition from the Italian General Confederation of Labor and its engineering workers' arm over the Turin agreement, which union officials said they considered an attack on labor rights.
